Message.Msg: don't fret about this. It's Darwinnian law, Out with the weak, in with the strong. It's all good.

Topic.Title: Mike Rayfield has left Nvidia, article

Message.Msg: Not only Tegra loses/breakeven point are climbing at an alarming rate, much faster than the rate of sales increase, but the whole program is so hopelessly delayed that they are behind their competitors like qcom. He took the fall for something alright, but not for FireHD. However, I suspect the real person responsible for the Tegra mess is still at nvda and until that guy is gone, nvda's stock price will linger.

Topic.Title: Mike Rayfield has left Nvidia, article

Message.Msg: That jerk of Charlie D. reported him leaving 2 years ago, the article is a joke and clearly expose his anti Nvidia sentiments, but let's acknowledge there could have been a little truth to it, so in that case Nvidia has known this for over two years. Big deal! LOL

Topic.Title: Apple A6 chip: 1.2 GHz dual-core A15 and PowerVR 6

Message.Msg: Anand is now claiming a custom core anandtech[dotcom]/show/6292/iphone-5-a6-not-a15-custom-core 'For a while now I'd heard that Apple was working on its own ARM based CPU core, but last I heard Apple was having issues making it work. I assumed that it was too early for Apple's own design to be ready. It turns out that it's not. Based on a lot of digging over the past couple of days, and conversations with the right people, I've confirmed that Apple's A6 SoC is based on Apple's own ARM based CPU core and not the Cortex A15.'

Topic.Title: Awaiting Anandtech to change its position on Apple A6 for the 4th time

Message.Msg: if he eats this one too, I will not be surprised. At least a couple of years ago, there were only 3 guys who got the lic. to build ARM cores - qcom, nvda, and, if memory serves me, as much as it sounds crazy, msft. I've never heard of aapl taking out a lic. to build ARM cores. At least not in public anyway
